numbered_ace_sentences: 1. Young people need to talk to their parents more often.
2. Parents will not be alive forever.
3. Girls tend to keep more in touch with their parents than boys.
6. I try to keep in touch with my parents.
7. Younger boys might have more trouble keeping in touch with their parents.
8. The percentage of young people who see their parents in person is the lowest among all groups.
9. Life tends to get busier when a person becomes older.
10. A person might not live in the same place as his or her parents.
11. I hope that people will make an effort to see their parents and their family.
12. A person has only a limited amount of time with his or her loved ones.
13. It is important that a person spends time with his or her loved ones while the person can.
15. Many other students in my community are currently at college.
16. Students who are away for school may not see their family all the time.
17. It might be hard to make frequent calls to family.
18. I can make a couple of calls to my parents per week.
19. The headline is: Connected But Disconnected.
